00030 /**
00031  * @brief Spawning of Ruby on Rails application instances.
00032  *
00033  * This class is responsible for spawning new instances of Ruby on Rails applications.
00034  * Use the spawn() method to do so.
00035  *
00036  * @note This class is fully thread-safe.
00037  *
00038  * <h2>Implementation details</h2>
00039  * Internally, this class makes use of a spawn server, which is written in Ruby. This server
00040  * is automatically started when a SpawnManager instance is created, and automatically
00041  * shutdown when that instance is destroyed. The existance of the spawn server is almost
00042  * totally transparent to users of this class. Spawn requests are sent to the server,
00043  * and details about the spawned process is returned.
00044  *
00045  * If the spawn server dies during the middle of an operation, it will be restarted.
00046  * See spawn() for full details.
00047  *
00048  * The communication channel with the server is anonymous, i.e. no other processes
00049  * can access the communication channel, so communication is guaranteed to be safe
00050  * (unless, of course, if the spawn server itself is a trojan).
00051  *
00052  * The server will try to keep the spawning time as small as possible, by keeping
00053  * corresponding Ruby on Rails frameworks and application code in memory. So the second
00054  * time an instance of the same application is spawned, the spawn time is significantly
00055  * lower than the first time. Nevertheless, spawning is a relatively expensive operation
00056  * (compared to the processing of a typical HTTP request/response), and so should be
00057  * avoided whenever possible.
00058  *
00059  * See the documentation of the spawn server for full implementation details.
00060  *
00061  * @ingroup Support
00062  */
00063 class SpawnManager {
00064 private:
00065         string spawnServerCommand;
00066         string logFile;
00067         string environment;
00068         string rubyCommand;
00069         
00070         mutex lock;
00071         
00072         MessageChannel channel;
00073         pid_t pid;
00074         bool serverNeedsRestart;

00076         /**
00077          * Restarts the spawn server.
00078          *
00079          * @throws SystemException An error occured while trying to setup the spawn server.
00080          * @throws IOException The specified log file could not be opened.
00081          */
00082         void restartServer() {
00083                 if (pid != 0) {
00084                         channel.close();
00085                         // TODO: should not wait infinitely
00086                         waitpid(pid, NULL, 0);
00087                         pid = 0;
00088                 }
00089                 
00090                 int fds[2];
00091                 FILE *logFileHandle = NULL;
00092                 
00093                 serverNeedsRestart = true;
00094                 if (socketpair(AF_UNIX, SOCK_STREAM, 0, fds) == -1) {
00095                         throw SystemException("Cannot create a Unix socket", errno);
00096                 }
00097                 if (!logFile.empty()) {
00098                         logFileHandle = fopen(logFile.c_str(), "a");
00099                         if (logFileHandle == NULL) {
00100                                 string message("Cannot open log file '");
00101                                 message.append(logFile);
00102                                 message.append("' for writing.");
00103                                 throw IOException(message);
00104                         }
00105                 }
00106 
00107                 pid = fork();
00108                 if (pid == 0) {
00109                         if (!logFile.empty()) {
00110                                 dup2(fileno(logFileHandle), STDERR_FILENO);
00111                                 fclose(logFileHandle);
00112                         }
00113                         dup2(STDERR_FILENO, STDOUT_FILENO);
00114                         if (!environment.empty()) {
00115                                 setenv("RAILS_ENV", environment.c_str(), true);
00116                         }
00117                         dup2(fds[1], STDIN_FILENO);
00118                         close(fds[0]);
00119                         close(fds[1]);
00120                         
00121                         // Close all other file descriptors
00122                         for (long i = sysconf(_SC_OPEN_MAX) - 1; i >= 0; i--) {
00123                                 if (i != STDIN_FILENO && i != STDOUT_FILENO && i != STDERR_FILENO) {
00124                                         close(i);
00125                                 }
00126                         }
00127                         
00128                         execlp(rubyCommand.c_str(),
00129                                 rubyCommand.c_str(),
00130                                 spawnServerCommand.c_str(),
00131                                 // The spawn server changes the process names of the subservers
00132                                 // that it starts, for better usability. However, the process name length
00133                                 // (as shown by ps) is limited. Here, we try to expand that limit by
00134                                 // deliberately passing a useless whitespace string to the spawn server.
00135                                 // This argument is ignored by the spawn server. This works on some
00136                                 // systems, such as Ubuntu Linux.
00137                                 "                                                             ",
00138                                 NULL);
00139                         int e = errno;
00140                         fprintf(stderr, "*** Passenger ERROR: Could not start the spawn server: %s: %s\n",
00141                                 rubyCommand.c_str(), strerror(e));
00142                         fflush(stderr);
00143                         _exit(1);
00144                 } else if (pid == -1) {
00145                         int e = errno;
00146                         close(fds[0]);
00147                         close(fds[1]);
00148                         if (logFileHandle != NULL) {
00149                                 fclose(logFileHandle);
00150                         }
00151                         pid = 0;
00152                         throw SystemException("Unable to fork a process", e);
00153                 } else {
00154                         close(fds[1]);
00155                         if (!logFile.empty()) {
00156                                 fclose(logFileHandle);
00157                         }
00158                         channel = MessageChannel(fds[0]);
00159                         serverNeedsRestart = false;
00160                         
00161                         #ifdef TESTING_SPAWN_MANAGER
00162                                 if (nextRestartShouldFail) {
00163                                         kill(pid, SIGTERM);
00164                                         usleep(500000);
00165                                 }
00166                         #endif
00167                 }
00168         }

00170         /**
00171          * Send the spawn command to the spawn server.
00172          *
00173          * @param appRoot The application root of the application to spawn.
00174          * @param lowerPrivilege Whether to lower the application's privileges.
00175          * @param lowestUser The user to fallback to if lowering privilege fails.
00176          * @return An Application smart pointer, representing the spawned application.
00177          * @throws SpawnException Something went wrong.
00178          */
00179         ApplicationPtr sendSpawnCommand(const string &appRoot, bool lowerPrivilege, const string &lowestUser) {
00180                 vector<string> args;
00181                 
00182                 try {
00183                         channel.write("spawn_application",
00184                                 appRoot.c_str(),
00185                                 (lowerPrivilege) ? "true" : "false",
00186                                 lowestUser.c_str(),
00187                                 NULL);
00188                 } catch (const SystemException &e) {
00189                         throw SpawnException(string("Could not write to the spawn server: ") + e.brief());
00190                 }
00191                 try {
00192                         if (!channel.read(args)) {
00193                                 throw SpawnException("The spawn server has exited unexpectedly.");
00194                         }
00195                 } catch (const SystemException &e) {
00196                         throw SpawnException(string("Could not read from the spawn server: ") + e.brief());
00197                 }
00198                 pid_t pid = atoi(args.front().c_str());
00199                 try {
00200                         int listenSocket = channel.readFileDescriptor();
00201                         return ApplicationPtr(new Application(appRoot, pid, listenSocket));
00202                 } catch (const IOException &e) {
00203                         string message("Could not receive a file descriptor from the spawn server: ");
00204                         message.append(e.what());
00205                         throw SpawnException(message);
00206                 } catch (const SystemException &e) {
00207                         string message("Could not receive a file descriptor from the spawn server: ");
00208                         message.append(e.brief());
00209                         throw SpawnException(message);
00210                 }
00211         }

00213         ApplicationPtr
00214         handleSpawnException(const SpawnException &e, const string &appRoot,
00215                              bool lowerPrivilege, const string &lowestUser) {
00216                 bool restarted;
00217                 try {
00218                         P_DEBUG("Spawn server died. Attempting to restart it...");
00219                         restartServer();
00220                         P_DEBUG("Restart seems to be successful.");
00221                         restarted = true;
00222                 } catch (const IOException &e) {
00223                         P_DEBUG("Restart failed: " << e.what());
00224                         restarted = false;
00225                 } catch (const SystemException &e) {
00226                         P_DEBUG("Restart failed: " << e.what());
00227                         restarted = false;
00228                 }
00229                 if (restarted) {
00230                         return sendSpawnCommand(appRoot, lowerPrivilege, lowestUser);
00231                 } else {
00232                         throw SpawnException("The spawn server died unexpectedly, and restarting it failed.");
00233                 }
00234         }
00235         
00236         IOException prependMessageToException(const IOException &e, const string &message) {
00237                 return IOException(message + ": " + e.what());
00238         }
00239         
00240         SystemException prependMessageToException(const SystemException &e, const string &message) {
00241                 return SystemException(message + ": " + e.brief(), e.code());
00242         }

00249         /**
00250          * Construct a new SpawnManager.
00251          *
00252          * @param spawnServerCommand The filename of the spawn server to use.
00253          * @param logFile Specify a log file that the spawn server should use.
00254          *            Messages on its standard output and standard error channels
00255          *            will be written to this log file. If an empty string is
00256          *            specified, no log file will be used, and the spawn server
00257          *            will use the same standard output/error channels as the
00258          *            current process.
00259          * @param environment The RAILS_ENV environment that all RoR applications
00260          *            should use. If an empty string is specified, the current value
00261          *            of the RAILS_ENV environment variable will be used.
00262          * @param rubyCommand The Ruby interpreter's command.
00263          * @throws SystemException An error occured while trying to setup the spawn server.
00264          * @throws IOException The specified log file could not be opened.
00265          */
00266         SpawnManager(const string &spawnServerCommand,
00267                      const string &logFile = "",
00268                      const string &environment = "production",
00269                      const string &rubyCommand = "ruby") {
00270                 this->spawnServerCommand = spawnServerCommand;
00271                 this->logFile = logFile;
00272                 this->environment = environment;
00273                 this->rubyCommand = rubyCommand;
00274                 pid = 0;
00275                 #ifdef TESTING_SPAWN_MANAGER
00276                         nextRestartShouldFail = false;
00277                 #endif
00278                 try {
00279                         restartServer();
00280                 } catch (const IOException &e) {
00281                         throw prependMessageToException(e, "Could not start the spawn server");
00282                 } catch (const SystemException &e) {
00283                         throw prependMessageToException(e, "Could not start the spawn server");
00284                 }
00285         }

00294         /**
00295          * Spawn a new instance of a Ruby on Rails application.
00296          *
00297          * If the spawn server died during the spawning process, then the server
00298          * will be automatically restarted, and another spawn attempt will be made.
00299          * If restarting the server fails, or if the second spawn attempt fails,
00300          * then an exception will be thrown.
00301          *
00302          * If <tt>lowerPrivilege</tt> is true, then it will be attempt to
00303          * switch the spawned application instance to the user who owns the
00304          * application's <tt>config/environment.rb</tt>, and to the default
00305          * group of that user.
00306          *
00307          * If that user doesn't exist on the system, or if that user is root,
00308          * then it will be attempted to switch to the username given by
00309          * <tt>lowestUser</tt> (and to the default group of that user).
00310          * If <tt>lowestUser</tt> doesn't exist either, or if switching user failed
00311          * (because the spawn server process does not have the privilege to do so),
00312          * then the application will be spawned anyway, without reporting an error.
00313          *
00314          * It goes without saying that lowering privilege is only possible if
00315          * the spawn server is running as root (and thus, by induction, that
00316          * Passenger and Apache's control process are also running as root).
00317          * Note that if Apache is listening on port 80, then its control process must
00318          * be running as root. See "doc/Security of user switching.txt" for
00319          * a detailed explanation.
00320          *
00321          * @param appRoot The application root of a RoR application, i.e. the folder that
00322          *             contains 'app/', 'public/', 'config/', etc. This must be a valid directory,
00323          *             but the path does not have to be absolute.
00324          * @param lowerPrivilege Whether to lower the application's privileges.
00325          * @param lowestUser The user to fallback to if lowering privilege fails.
00326          * @return A smart pointer to an Application object, which represents the application
00327          *         instance that has been spawned. Use this object to communicate with the
00328          *         spawned application.
00329          * @throws SpawnException Something went wrong.
00330          */
00331         ApplicationPtr spawn(const string &appRoot, bool lowerPrivilege = true, const string &lowestUser = "nobody") {
00332                 vector<string> args;
00333                 mutex::scoped_lock l(lock);
00334                 
00335                 try {
00336                         return sendSpawnCommand(appRoot, lowerPrivilege, lowestUser);
00337                 } catch (const SpawnException &e) {
00338                         return handleSpawnException(e, appRoot, lowerPrivilege, lowestUser);
00339                 }
00340         }
00341

00343          * Get the Process ID of the spawn server. This method is used in the unit tests

00345          */
00346         pid_t getServerPid() const {
00347                 return pid;
00348         }
